Class Character

  • java.lang.Object
    • handlers.Character

  • public class Character
extends java.lang.Object
    The Character class represents the users character.
    Author:
    Trym Staurheim

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      (package private) class  Character.RandomRoll
      The RandomRoll class handles the integers parsed with scanner to SetStats Method.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void backGroundInfo()
      Helper method to print the instanced Background child String name with background.getBackGroundName() method.
      private void chooseAge()
      Sets the character age on Character object with a instanced Scanner and prints the age to the user.
      private Background chooseBackground(java.lang.String input)
      chooseBackground() uses the instanced Scanner from isBackGroundChosen() method and returns a new Background child based on the users input.
      private void chooseGender()
      Sets the character gender on Character object with a instanced Scanner and prints the gender to the user, note: We have no limits on gender to support gender diversity in a fantasy setting.
      private void chooseName()
      Sets the character name on Character object with a instanced Scanner and prints the name to the user note: as this is a program for a fantasy game, there are no limit for what a name can be, thus any symbol is allowed.

      chooseRace() uses the instanced Scanner from isRaceChosen() method and returns a new Race child based on the users input.

      chooseRole() uses the instanced Scanner from isRoleChosen() method and returns a new Role child based on the users input.

      private void halfElfIncreaseStat()
      This method handles the manual stat increase done by the user if the instanced (@code Race) child String String name is of dynamic type Half-Elf.

      The method increases the Character objects stored Stat values by the amount asserted by the instanced Race objects getRaceIncreaseStats method and getAvailableStats method.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Character

        public Character()
        Constructor for the Character class. Creates an object of type Character with properties from Stat, Race, Role and Background

    • Method Detail

      • setStats

        private void setStats()
        The method setStats() generates the characters stat values from Roller and instances a RandomRoll Array to store these values. These values are then assigned to Stat objects that are initialized and put into the ArrayList stat. These Stat values are then stored on the character object. The method uses the RandomRoll inner class to control for used integers. The method also calls on the printStats() to iterate and print all elements of type Stat
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the Integer converted to string is of incorrect format
        See Also:
        class for how the integers are generated., for how Stat type objets are constructed., for methods

      • printStats

        private void printStats()
        Handles the printing of the characters Stats Uses the Utilities to format the type String and ResourceBundles to get the property file "Character". prints to the user a colored text string: Your stats are: followed by a for each loop that prints out Elements of type Stat in ArrayList stat.

      • printCompleteCharacter

        private void printCompleteCharacter()
        Prints the entire character to the user, when the character is complete. uses printChosenSkills for easier printing of the characters skills. uses printStats for printing the characters stats.

      • printChosenSkills

        private void printChosenSkills()
        Prints the stored Skill objects in the Role objects ArrayList of Type Skill which are then printed with a for each loop.

      • increaseCharacterStats

        private void increaseCharacterStats()
        The method increases the Character objects stored Stat values by the amount asserted by the instanced Race objects getRaceIncreaseStats method and getAvailableStats method. These values are instanced by the Race ChooseRace method.

      • chooseName

        private void chooseName()
        Sets the character name on Character object with a instanced Scanner and prints the name to the user note: as this is a program for a fantasy game, there are no limit for what a name can be, thus any symbol is allowed.

      • chooseGender

        private void chooseGender()
        Sets the character gender on Character object with a instanced Scanner and prints the gender to the user, note: We have no limits on gender to support gender diversity in a fantasy setting.

      • chooseAge

        private void chooseAge()
                throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Sets the character age on Character object with a instanced Scanner and prints the age to the user. The age is affected by the Race child objects maxAge value variable.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the Integer converted to String is of the wrong format

      • isRaceChosen

        private Race isRaceChosen()
        This method asserts through a loop that the instanced Race object is not null by instancing a scanner that runs the chooseRace method when the instanced race object is not equal to null the loop exits.
        Returns:
        race with a dynamic type of the chosen race child instanced by the chooseRace() method.

      • printChoices

        private void printChoices(java.lang.String[] temp)
        printChoices() is a helper method that loops over an Array and prints the choices.
        Parameters:
        temp - represents the temporary String array that printChoices() loops over.

      • chooseRace

        private Race chooseRace(java.lang.String input)
        chooseRace() uses the instanced Scanner from isRaceChosen() method and returns a new Race child based on the users input.
        Parameters:
        input - reader from isRaceChosen() to set a child on Race object.
        Returns:
        new race object child with the child properties from the Race child constructors.
        See Also:
        Dragonborn, Dwarf, Elf, Gnome, HalfElf, Halfling, HalfOrc, Human, Race, Tiefling

      • raceInfo

        private void raceInfo()
        Helper method to print the instanced Race child String name with race.getName() method.

      • roleInfo

        private void roleInfo()
        Helper method to print the instanced Role child String name with role.getRoleName() method.

      • backGroundInfo

        private void backGroundInfo()
        Helper method to print the instanced Background child String name with background.getBackGroundName() method.

      • halfElfIncreaseStat

        private void halfElfIncreaseStat()
        This method handles the manual stat increase done by the user if the instanced (@code Race) child String String name is of dynamic type Half-Elf. Else it prints that the user have successfully increased all their stats.

      • IsRoleChosen

        private Role IsRoleChosen()
        This method asserts through a loop that the instanced Role object is not null by instancing a scanner that runs the chooseRole method when the instanced race object is not equal to null the loop exits.
        Returns:
        role with a dynamic type of the chosen Role child instanced by the chooseRace() method.

      • chooseRole

        private Role chooseRole(java.lang.String input)
        chooseRole() uses the instanced Scanner from isRoleChosen() method and returns a new Role child based on the users input. It also instances an arrayList of type Skills to store of skills object of that type on object
        Parameters:
        input - reader from isRoleChosen() to set a child on Role object.
        Returns:
        new role object child with the child properties from the Role child constructors.
        See Also:
        Barbarian, Cleric, Druid, Fighter, Paladin, Rogue

      • printRoleSkills

        private void printRoleSkills()
        Helper method that prints the available type String objects stored in the instanced Role child objects role.availableRoleSkills() method

      • chooseRoleSkills

        private void chooseRoleSkills()
                       throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        Deprecated. error this method has a currently unhandled error of InputMissMatch exception that exits the loop. It will be fixed for v.02
        chooseRoleSkills() uses the instanced Role child get.AmountOfSkills() method. It instances a Scanner object for the user to choose which skills they want to be proficient in. The method loops til the amountOfSkills condition is met and adds the selected skill to the Role child objects Skill ArrayList getChosenRoleSkills().
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the parsed String is of the wrong format.

      • isBackGroundChosen

        private Background isBackGroundChosen()
        This method asserts through a loop that the instanced Background object is not null by instancing a scanner that runs the chooseBackground method. When the instanced race object is not equal to null the loop exits.
        Returns:
        background with a dynamic type of the chosen Background child instanced by the chooseBackground() method.

      • chooseBackground

        private Background chooseBackground(java.lang.String input)
        chooseBackground() uses the instanced Scanner from isBackGroundChosen() method and returns a new Background child based on the users input. It also runs any inherent methods of the Background child, if there are any during instancing of the new Background child object.
        Parameters:
        input - reader from isBackGroundChosen() to set a child on Background object.
        Returns:
        new Background object child with the child properties from the Background child constructors.
        See Also:
        Acolyte, Criminal, Background

      • setName

        private void setName(java.lang.String nameIn)
        sets the name of the instanced Character object during construction.
        Parameters:
        nameIn - takes the String characters and sets in on the variable name.

      • setAge

        private void setAge(int ageIn)
        sets the age of the instanced Character object during construction.
        Parameters:
        ageIn - takes the int value and sets it on the variable age.

      • setGender

        private void setGender(java.lang.String genderIn)
        sets the gener of the instanced Character object during construction.
        Parameters:
        genderIn - takes the String characters and sets it on the variable gender.
